newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary grains futures price decline slows.
newsitem.headline: Hungary grains futures price decline slows.

text.p: Hungarian maize and wheat futures tended to continue lower on Friday although the most actively traded August maturity remained steady at 23,700 forints.
Traders said the weakness of the selling side slowed the pace of decline.
The price falls on the Budapest Commodity Exchange have been triggered by rains after weeks of hot and dry weather which was feared to harm the crop, traders said.
"It is raining and the prices are falling," said Robert Monostori of Agrimpex Termenykereskedelmi Kft.
Traders said heavy-weight market players were buying grains futures, but at the current low price levels few producers were inclined to sell and that slowed down the pace of price falls.

Sellers are cautious as earlier this year a slump in prices was followed by sharp price rises and many market players believe that prices can soar again if the weather and export outlooks turn worse, traders said.
Most milling wheat futures dropped by 200 to 360 forints.
The pattern was the same with maize futures, as most of them eased, but the heavily traded July maturity finished unchanged at 20,000 forints.
Traders said the July maturity was near and speculators, who held a large stock of open short positions, began to close them.
"Those who bought, were likely to liquidate," said Monostori.
However, there was a large buyer -- OTP Forex Rt -- on the market, too, traders added.
The BCE's grains futures turnover rose to 342 million forints or 673 lots from 199.3 million forints or 416 lots on Thursday.
